alert.note: Alert for Brookings; Moody (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:00PM MDT until April 19 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Union and Plymouth Counties. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Sioux, Union and Lincoln Counties. West Fork Des Moines River near Avoca affecting Murray and Cottonwood Counties. James River near Forestburg affecting Sanborn County. James River at Huron affecting Beadle County. James River near Mitchell affecting Davison and Hanson Counties. Big Sioux River near Trent affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River near Egan affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River near Richland affecting Union and Plymouth Counties. Big Sioux River at Brandon affecting Lyon, Minnehaha and Lincoln Counties. Big Sioux River near Estelline affecting Hamlin and Brookings Counties. Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River near Brookings. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, flooding begins to affect agricultural lands along the right bank of the river. At 10.3 feet, 473rd Avenue north of the gauge begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM CDT Saturday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning and continue falling to 7.0 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Big Sioux River Brookings 9.0 10.6 Sat 8 pm 10.1 9.4 8.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late Sunday morning.
